TopicTitle: [AAR] The Grand Tour - Voyage To The Planets

Articles.Content: SoonÃ¢â€žÂ¢ is always soon Plus, don't forget about this golden rule:
Oh come on! It's been away too looong. I've been here every day of rthe past week and nothing. Disappoint

Oh come on! It's been away too looong. I've been here every day of rthe past week and nothing. Disappoint

May I remind you that I'm doing this for fun - it's not my job and you are not my boss. So if you want to motivate me, I would prefer this...

...rather than angry comments

EDIT: Besides, I have also other projects:

Plus, I don't have unlimited time. Please remember that.

Edited November 26, 2013 by czokletmuss
which game is that? it remember a lot the "Total War" Series!

which game is that? it remember a lot the "Total War" Series!

Crusader Kings II

Much better than TW series if you ask me (and I played everything since first Medieval:TW). But let's not start OT please

Crusader Kings II

Much better than TW series if you ask me (and I played everything since first Medieval:TW). But let's not start OT please

You ought to do A CK2-EU4-All the other ones AAR, that might work.

Now, back to deconstructing the Norse Pagan, Ethnically East African Kingdom of Troy centered around The Aegean and modern Romania...

UPDATE

After serious problems with good old Grand Tour 0.22 folder and hours spent on fine-tuninng (that is, deleting every part, spaces or other file which isn't used by the GT save) I managed to shove off more or less 350MB of memory load. Now I can finally play in the Grand Tour save without crashes every hour - alas, the FPS is still low.

The good news is, it finally works. The save file is the same, so don't worry, there isn't any lack of continuity. Apart from lack of new chapter in the past two weeks (!). Please be patient a little more, the next release status is "pending" and it will come out Soon - this time for real
well that's always good when you can shave off a good hunk of ram usage, can't wait for the next chapter.

[ARCHIWUM]

???

Also do you have different mods on the KASA and SOVIET installs? Didn't think of that.

well that's always good when you can shave off a good hunk of ram usage, can't wait for the next chapter.

You won't have to wait long.

[ARCHIWUM] ???

Also do you have different mods on the KASA and SOVIET installs? Didn't think of that.

It's "archive" in English - 0.20.2 and 0.21 versions plus some old backup files. That way even if Grand Tour folder evaporates I can still finish the story using backup saves and 0.22.2 KSP.

Yup, I have to - my crappy laptop wouldn't handle all the mods at once. FASA aren't so bad but all of BobCat's and MrTheBull mods together are very memory-consuming.

What terrain detail level do you have? I find that with my integrated graphics, just looking at it murders the CPU. It can still be laggy when I look at the planet but not nearly as much as with detail on high. But if textures are on it still looks decent-ish.

Hey, I'm coming back after a long hiatus, and I just wanted to say thanks for inspiring me to write KSP stories. It has really helped my writing in general, and it's really fun! You are my favorite KSP writer, and we could use more writers like you! Thanks!
WTF still no new chapter? It's been about a month now..........

WTF still no new chapter? It's been about a month now..........

Listen son, I'm getting real tired of your ****

Seriously, have you ever paid for this? No, I didn't think so. Even if you had donated to him, it is not binding him to do anything for you.

Think about this: Some guy shows up to you, and offers to mow your lawn freely. However one week he can't make it. Would you then go bananas on him ey?

If he couldnt for like 4 weeks in a row then yes, I would.

I was patient for a week, then 2, 3, but 4 is just crazy and there is no ETA

Its called life, sometimes things come up and you have to put things on hold. I wouldnt care if it was a month between the release of every chapter, this story is that good. So just chill a little and let him work his magic...

If he couldnt for like 4 weeks in a row then yes, I would.

I was patient for a week, then 2, 3, but 4 is just crazy and there is no ETA

Last chapter was released on 16th November, 16 days ago. That's 2 weeks.

As much as I like writing this story, it doesn't pay my bills, so I can't dedicate all my time to it (no matter how cool it be to spend more time with "Proteus") - I have to work. Not that I'm complaining about donations - most AAR writers don't get a dime and I got a few (literally) bucks, so I'm fine. But please don't be rude - I have no obligation to write this story. In fact, instead of writing it I can do a lot of thing with my free time, even play recently bought on a Steam sale "Max Payne 3" or just take a nap.

And there won't be ETA ever, unless I feel confident in 100% that I can deliver the next chapter, which usually means that it's done and ready, so there's no point in ETA anyways.

TBH I'm considering pushing the release for 1-2 days for every... expression of entitlement like this.

TBH I'm considering pushing the release for 1-2 days for every... expression of entitlement like this.

Called the Squad Model. It works quite well.

Also, there are much nicer or more subtle/humorous ways to say that you are looking forward to the next release, especially seeing as it's been a little bit longer this time around, but "WTF" doesn't even give anyone the impression that you really want to stick around here.

And yes, it is still selfish to go publicly crazy even after 2 or 3 or 4 weeks for this sort of thing.

All writers suffer the demands of their readers czokletmuss. Just look at J. K. Rowling and Sir Arthur Conan Doyle.

But they shouldn't be abused and harrassed by members posting demands for updates and new chapters.

I myself have been tempted over the past week to ask when the next chapter will be posted; but have resisted (until now i guess .) I just say to myself check back tomorrow.

I must say the wait between chapters is almost unbearable; but makes each one so much more rewarding when they are posted. Besides there is no point having a cliff-hanger ending if the story continues to soonÃ¢â€žÂ¢. So i will continue to, as soon as I've read a chapter, want more. But, I have to accept that I must be patient and wait; space is vast and it must take awhile for the stories to get back to Kerbin after all.

Please keep up the hard work czokletmuss I'm sure the silent majority fully appriciate your hard work and supports you in your creative process.

Edited December 3, 2013 by peter1981

Geez guys, getting far to aggressive at each other- instead of writing yourself as you crudely put it, master patience. Its hard but beneficial
